how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Programming
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does:
It is a convenient "brain dump" to keep my thoughts focused. I can take notes of my ideas and know, that I do not loose them. So I can go back later and refine the ideas. 

I collect links to interesting topics. I and copy paste content from the web to not loose it to link rot.

as you selected diy, would be grateful f:
I do have a NAS to backup all my important stuff.

what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
I do like the Tiddlywiki community, because it is friendly and welcoming. This is a strong advantage over other communities. 

I would love to have an empty.html with a compressed core. So the wiki itself has a smaller file size.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I personally will not leave TW in the near future. I am way to invested already and may "link management" wiki runs as a Windows WebDav service, which is active at startup.

I may move the MWS TW to my NAS so I can access it from every device connected to the network.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
